label: spam
subject: At before mannschoice
body: 3. It has also been observed that neither fishes nor serpents have testicles, but they have two passages hanging down on each side of the spine from the diaphragm, and these unite in one passage above the anus, by above, we mean nearer the spinal column. At the season of coition these passages are full of semen, which exudes on pressure; the differences among these may be seen by dissection, and in another place they will each be considered more particularly.
